skill.name: arboreto
skill.description: Infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from gene expression data using scalable algorithms (GRNBoost2, GENIE3). Use when analyzing transcriptomics data (bulk RNA-seq, single-cell RNA-seq) to identify transcription factor-target gene relationships and regulatory interactions. Supports distributed computation for large-scale datasets.
skill.summary: Infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from gene expression data using scalable algorithms (GRNBoost2...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Safe bioinformatics tool for gene regulatory network inference. No security concerns detected. Only accesses user-provided data files and writes output to specified locations.

content.user_title: Analyze gene regulatory networks with AI
content.value_statement: Gene regulatory network inference helps identify which transcription factors regulate which genes. This skill enables automated GRN analysis from transcriptomics data using scalable algorithms.
actual_capabilities: Infer gene regulatory networks from expression data
Support both bulk RNA-seq and single-cell RNA-seq data
Use GRNBoost2 algorithm for fast large-scale inference
Use GENIE3 algorithm for comparison and validation
Scale from single machines to multi-node clusters
limitations: Requires Python with scientific computing libraries
Expression data must be properly normalized
Large datasets may require distributed computing setup
Results depend on data quality and experimental design

use_cases.title: Single-cell GRN analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze single-cell RNA-seq data to identify cell-type-specific regulatory networks and transcription factor activities.

use_cases.title: Comparative transcriptomics
use_cases.description: Compare gene regulatory networks between control and treatment conditions to understand regulatory mechanisms.

use_cases.title: Large-scale network inference
use_cases.description: Process massive transcriptomics datasets using distributed computing for comprehensive regulatory network mapping.

prompt_templates.title: Basic GRN inference
prompt_templates.prompt: Use arboreto to infer gene regulatory networks from my expression matrix. The data is in a TSV file with genes as columns and samples as rows.

prompt_templates.title: Single-cell analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me analyze single-cell RNA-seq data to find transcription factor-target relationships. I have 10,000 cells and want to use GRNBoost2.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative networks
prompt_templates.prompt: Infer GRNs for control and treatment conditions separately, then help me identify differential regulatory interactions.

prompt_templates.title: Distributed computing
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up distributed GRN inference for my large dataset. I need to process 50,000 cells x 20,000 genes using a cluster.

output_examples.input: Infer gene regulatory network from my expression data

best_practices: Always set a random seed for reproducible results
Filter low-variance genes before inference to improve signal
Use transcription factor lists to reduce computation time
Validate findings with biological knowledge or experimental data
anti_patterns: Running without if __name__ == '__main__' guard (causes Dask errors)
Using GENIE3 for very large datasets (use GRNBoost2 instead)
Inferring networks from unnormalized count data
Ignoring computational resource requirements for large datasets

faq.question: What data formats does arboreto support?
faq.answer: Arboreto accepts pandas DataFrames or NumPy arrays. Genes must be columns, observations (cells/samples) must be rows.

faq.question: How do I handle memory errors with large datasets?
faq.answer: Use distributed computing with Dask, filter low-variance genes, or process data in batches.

faq.question: Can I integrate arboreto with other bioinformatics tools?
faq.answer: Yes, arboreto outputs standard TSV format compatible with downstream analysis tools and is part of the SCENIC pipeline.

faq.question: Is my gene expression data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, all processing is local. No data is transmitted to external servers or cloud services.

faq.question: Why am I getting empty results?
faq.answer: Check that gene names match between expression data and TF list, ensure proper data format, and verify expression values are numeric.

faq.question: How does GRNBoost2 compare to GENIE3?
faq.answer: GRNBoost2 is faster and better for large datasets. Both use similar inference strategies but different regression methods.
